sc.fiji.snt.analysis

Class TreeStatistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.scijava.AbstractContextual
      • org.scijava.command.ContextCommand
        • sc.fiji.snt.analysis.TreeAnalyzer
          • sc.fiji.snt.analysis.TreeStatistics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, org.scijava.Cancelable, org.scijava.command.Command, org.scijava.Contextual, org.scijava.plugin.SciJavaPlugin
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultiTreeStatistics

    public class TreeStatistics
extends TreeAnalyzer
    Computes summary and descriptive statistics from univariate properties of Paths and Nodes in a Tree. For analysis of groups of Trees use MultiTreeStatistics.
    Author:
    Tiago Ferreira

      • VALUES

        public static final java.lang.String VALUES
        Flag for analysis of "Node intensity values", an optional numeric property that can be assigned to Path nodes (e.g., voxel intensities, assigned via PathProfiler. Note that an IllegalArgumentException is triggered if no values have been assigned to the tree being analyzed.
        See Also:
        Path.hasNodeValues(), PathProfiler.assignValues(), Constant Field Values

      • getHistogram

        public SNTChart getHistogram(java.lang.String metric)
        Gets the relative frequencies histogram for a univariate measurement. The number of bins is determined using the Freedman-Diaconis rule.
        Parameters:
        metric - the measurement (N_NODES, NODE_RADIUS, etc.)
        Returns:
        the frame holding the histogram
